data.title: NEA, ECs and MCOs: Partners in Rural Electrification and Development
data.meta_description: National Electrification Administration | NEA, ECs and MCOs: Partners in Rural Electrification and Development
data.text:
Published: 04 July 2024

The National Electrification Administration (NEA) has launched on Thursday, 04 July 2024, its National Command Center (NCC), marking a significant innovation in terms of monitoring and managing the operations of the 121 electric cooperatives (ECs) nationwide.

Administrator Antonio Mariano Almeda led the inauguration of this new facility located at the ground floor of the NEA building in Quezon City. The NCC is one of his flagship projects with the end goal of optimizing the technical and operational performance of ECs across the country.

“Rural Electrification is not anymore limited to simply extending distribution lines to households, but now also includes establishing systems for resiliency and energy security,” Administrator Almeda said at the launch ceremony.

Read more: Transforming Electrification Management: NEA Unveils National Command Center

Published: 21 June 2024

Dear FOI Requestors and Advocates: Important Announcement on eFOI Portal Upgrade The FOI-PMO is upgrading the Electronic Freedom of Information (eFOI) portal to ensure optimal performance and enhance user experience. During this time, the eFOI Portal will undergo temporary maintenance. For urgent inquiries, please do not hesitate to contact us at <This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it. > or submit a ticket request at <bit.ly/FOIHELPDESK>. Thank you for your continued support of the FOI Program.
